bit.ly/3157-cal

http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~jae/3157/?asof=20180115

http://www.cs.columbia.edu/~jae/papers/3157-paper-v2.2-camera-final.pdf

Review sessions exist, sometime monday - friday
This weekend - jumpstart on Unix. 

Fundamentals and AP can be taken together


3 parts of the course:
1) C
Labs 1-4

2) Unix system
  • Process control, signal, IO, TCP/IP networking
  • Sockets API and HTTP protocol
    • web server from scratch!

3) C++
  • C++ language
  • Generic programming


Tips
Start HW’s early
Pay attention to emails for announcements and questions. Everything is time sensitive.
Attention to detail — FOLLOW ALL INSTRUCTIONS
understand EVERYTHING precisely
Don’t just get the code working 00 also, don’t code by trial and error 
Learn to read code on paper
see if you can recreate the code without looking 
Attend all the lectures and pay attention


7 late days total, up to 2 can be used for a single lab


  • [cs3157] - All emails from class listserve
  • [ANN] - important announcements from me or TA’s
  • [LABn] - Information relevant to a lab
